It was 30 years ago today when my older brother Joe started full time work at the J.R. Simplot Company as a 14 year old kid working at the JR Simplot Caldwell plant. Joe thought he had better ideas on how to ferment alcohol from potato waste for fuel using the bacteria Zymomonas Mobilis rather than yeast.
I was proud of Joe then and I'm proud of him today.
Finding that perfect home can be complex, but not when you shop PV Ranch real estate. Learn more about all this beautiful area has to offer: https://goo.gl/z7phee

This brand new home has everything we've come to expect from Arcadia's unique cottage style. The island kitchen is stunning, the great room makes a bold statement with a beautiful fireplace, custom ceiling, incredible custom mill work and a wall of french doors leading to the beautiful backyard. All of the ensuite bedrooms are outstanding, including an exquisite master retreat, and the large office is another impressive attribute. The home's extraordinary character is enhanced by quality finishes including magnificent wood flooring, custom cabinetry, pristine marble, artistic tile accents and dramatic lighting. A wide open floor plan, fabulous design elements and sun filled rooms with thoughtful designer accents combine to make this a very special residence. https://goo.gl/9nSMBH

As Accredited Staging Professionals (ASP) our company specializes in preparing your property so it will sell quickly and for significantly more money. I have been staging homes throughout my 30 year real estate career, even more so in the past 6 years. Because of the success I have enjoyed with staging for both myself and my clients, I made the decision to expand into opening and operating a full service staging company in February of 2013.Through experience I have come to recognize professional home staging is one of the most important and valuable tools available to any property owner. Our company is committed to making staging available to anyone in any price point who wants to maximize their return on equity and reduce the length of time involved in the selling process.

Created product concept, developed industry strategy, created education program and verification process to implement and distribute a system for our membership program certifying the efforts made by small businesses and entrepreneurs in charitable giving, volunteer work and social responsibility.Business brand development and marketing system including strategic business planning and sales strategy development.Research of charitable giving challenges and innovative development of best practice solutions to facilitate sustainable charitable giving between small businesses and charitable organizations.Education course research, curriculum planning, design, creation and implementation of LMS education course to designate member enrollees.Crafted membership rules, by-laws, and established designation membership standards.Our IT team created a comprehensive database management system allowing for member enrollment, LMS education for certification, referral networking and verification of charitable donations and volunteer time for each of our members.The CCG Alliance's goal is to fundamentally change for the better the way charitable giving is done in the US.  We believe through education and a comprehensive support network, along with voluntary member verification of donations we can create a win-win-win cycle of sustainable giving-benefiting communities, worthy charities and small businesses alike.

By earning the CCGA Designation, members demonstrate their commitment to integrating charitable giving into their business plan. As a verified member of the Certified Charitable Giving Alliance, our members are recognized for their involvement in creating a healthier and more prosperous world for everyone, because Giving is good business.™

As a board member for Bridging Arizona Furniture Bank my role is to help inform the real estate community about the widespread, ongoing need for home furnishings for people who secure shelter after being homeless or in temporary housing or after an extended stay in hospitals/mental institutions.  My experience as a Realtor and Home Stager introduced me to Furniture Banks and I've learned that the majority of people don't know that when the less fortunate finally obtain housing, they almost never have a bed to sleep in or a simple dining table and chairs where they can eat their meals.  These are 'luxuries' most of us take for granted.   Many children are literally sleeping on floors because they don't have a bed; NO child should have to sleep on a floor in the United States of America.My intent is to expand public awareness of this situation and help increase revenue and furniture donations for Furniture Banks. Furniture Banks collect new and used home furnishings, along with cash contributions from public and private donors (who receive tax deductions for their donations) and then purchase and/or repair and refurbish the furnishings they bring in.  They then distribute these same household items to people who are in need throughout our community.I am educating the real estate community about the need for these items and working to educate our clients to help supply Furniture Banks with their client's own donated household furnishings.  Often these same items are discarded or sold for pennies on the dollar: the public isn't aware of the significant needs of Furniture Banks or of the purpose they serve.  Also the public is unaware of the personal tax benefits available to them when donating.  Please view the attached link for more information about Bridging Arizona, the largest furniture bank in the greater Phoenix area   http://www.bridgingaz.com/donate/tax-credits/If you have questions or would like to know more please call me for more information.

summary: The CCGA designation allows small businesses and entrepreneurs to quickly and effectively communicate their efforts in charitable giving and social responsibility to the public.  WWW.CCGALLIANCE.COMWhat We Do:  Our Alliance Membership educates our members in how to choose worthwhile charities and social causes to support in their businesses in order to increase profitability, expand their influence, promote what they believe in through the organizations they contribute to and improve their communities.Our Certified (Certified Charitable Giver) Membership provides all the same benefits of the Alliance Membership and also verifies the contributions our members make based on our minimum participation standards of financial and/or volunteer time donations.  CCG's enjoy using and promoting their designation with marketing materials and by displaying the CCGA logo, are included in our referral network and among other benefits are included in exclusive CCG membership trainings and events.How We Do It: We educate online and through live seminars.  We share methods for expanding our member's small business profitability, influence and reach using our recommended campaigns and techniques.  With our program, members have a framework to share discuss/promote causes that align with their own values; worthwhile causes that THEY choose.  For Certified Members, among other things, we verify their contributions thereby giving them a platform to discuss how they tangibly demonstrate their financial and volunteer time involvement in their communities.Who We Work With: Any small business or entrepreneur who wants to improve their profits, increase their influence, expand their leadership skills, support their causes and impact their communities through their businesses.  We help small businesses do what major corporations have been doing for decades!Want To Join Our Alliance?  Just go to WWW.CCGALLIANCE.COM and click the 'Enroll Now' tab to get started!
